meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of hell or the underworld.
meanings.sent1: The infernal flames burned brightly in the dark cavern.
meanings.sent2: The infernal creatures lurked in the shadows of the underworld.
meanings.sent3: The infernal heat in the kitchen made cooking unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The infernal noise of the construction site felt like a descent into hell.
meanings.sent5: The infernal smell of sulfur filled the air, creating a sinister atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The infernal mosquito buzzed around my head all night.
meanings.sent2: The infernal traffic jam made me late for work.
meanings.sent3: The infernal alarm clock refused to stop ringing.
meanings.sent4: The infernal computer virus corrupted all my files.
meanings.sent5: The infernal dripping faucet kept me awake with its constant rhythm.

meanings.definition: Used for emphasis or to express strong disapproval.
meanings.sent1: I am tired of your infernal excuses for being late.
meanings.sent2: The infernal mess in the living room needs to be cleaned up.
meanings.sent3: Stop with your infernal whining about everything.
meanings.sent4: I can't stand your infernal habit of interrupting others.
meanings.sent5: Her infernal gossiping caused unnecessary drama in the office.
